Class EnvironmentUtils

java.lang.Object
jeroenfl.csvprocessor.config.EnvironmentUtils
public class EnvironmentUtils extends Object
Utility class for handling environment variables and system properties.

This class provides convenient methods for accessing configuration values from environment variables with fallback mechanisms. It supports both optional configuration with defaults and required configuration that throws exceptions when missing.

All methods in this class are static and the class is designed to be used as a utility without instantiation.

Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
JeroenFL

  • Constructor Details

    • EnvironmentUtils

      public EnvironmentUtils()
      Default constructor.

      This is a utility class with static methods only and should not be instantiated. All methods are thread-safe and can be called concurrently.

  • Method Details

    • envOrProp

      public static String envOrProp(String key, String defaultValue)
      Gets value from environment variable or system property, with fallback to default.

      This method first checks for an environment variable with the given key. If the environment variable is not found or is empty, the default value is returned instead.

      Parameters:
      key - the environment variable name to look up
      defaultValue - the value to return if the environment variable is not found or empty
      Returns:
      the environment variable value or the default value
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if key is null

    • envOrDefault

      public static String envOrDefault(String key, String defaultValue)
      Gets value from environment variable with fallback to default.

      This method is functionally identical to envOrProp(String, String) but provides a more explicit name for cases where only environment variables (not system properties) are being consulted.

      Parameters:
      key - the environment variable name to look up
      defaultValue - the value to return if the environment variable is not found or empty
      Returns:
      the environment variable value or the default value
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if key is null

    • mustGetEnv

      public static String mustGetEnv(String key)
      Gets required environment variable, throws exception if not found.

      This method retrieves an environment variable that is considered mandatory for application operation. If the environment variable is not set or is empty, an IllegalStateException is thrown with a descriptive error message.

      Use this method for critical configuration values that must be provided externally, such as database URLs, API keys, or service endpoints.

      Parameters:
      key - the environment variable name to look up
      Returns:
      the environment variable value
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the environment variable is missing or empty
      NullPointerException - if key is null
